mapper.select: select a.open_id as 'openId' ,a.nick_name as 'nickName' ,b.name as 'name' ,b.mobile as 'mobile' ,b.publish_id as 'publishId' ,b.fetch_status as 'fetchStatus' from t_user a inner join t_user_share b on a.open_id = b.open_id and b.fetch_status = 1 and b.publish_id = #{publisId}

select a.*,b.sub_user_num_act as 'subUserNumAct' from ( SELECT a.publish_id AS 'publishId', a.open_id AS 'openId', a.fetch_status AS 'fetchStatus', a.NAME AS 'name', a.mobile AS 'mobile', b.title AS 'title', b.ticket_total AS 'ticketTotal', b.ticket_sale AS 'ticketSale', b.ticket_remain AS 'ticketRemain', b.sub_user_num AS 'subUserNum', c.nick_name AS 'nickName' from t_user_share a inner JOIN t_publish b ON a.publish_id = b.id inner JOIN t_user c ON a.open_id = c.open_id )a left JOIN ( SELECT a.parent_open_id, a.publish_id,count(*) sub_user_num_act FROM t_user a GROUP BY a.parent_open_id, a.publish_id ) b ON a.openId = b.parent_open_id and a.publishId = b.publish_id where 1=1
and a.name like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{param.name},'%'))
and a.mobile like CONCAT(CONCAT('%',#{param.mobile},'%'))
and a.subUserNum <= b.sub_user_num_act
and a.subUserNum > b.sub_user_num_act or b.sub_user_num_act is null

select * from ( SELECT c.id, c.open_id, c.nick_name, c.parent_open_id, a.publish_id, a.name, a.mobile, a.fetch_status from t_user_share a inner JOIN t_publish b ON a.publish_id = b.id inner JOIN t_user c ON a.open_id = c.open_id )a where a.parent_open_id = #{openId} and a.publish_id = #{publishId}
